intro: Stillingia tenuis, commonly known as the narrowleaf stillingia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Papaveraceae, which includes poppies and other flowering plants with showy blooms. The plant is characterized by its slender, lance-shaped leaves and delicate, yellowish-orange flowers that appear in late summer. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils in open woodland areas. Stillingia tenuis is often found in dry, sunny habitats and is adapted to thrive in arid environments.
